AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: No customer-facing AI responses are present that are broken, misleading, or contradicted. The public replies are from named support staff and are coherent updates/escalations.
evidence: Deepanshu Dewan commented publicly: "As discussed, your ticket has been assigned to an agent. You will receive an update soon with the preliminary analysis completed so far."
Pavly Nashed commented publicly: "We have investigated the root cause of the issue, and this has been escalated to our infrastructure team with the highest priority..."

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: The customer was not kept in an AI loop; a human responded promptly after the customer’s urgent follow-up and continued human communication followed.
evidence: Customer: "Issue is happening again now. Can you look into this on priority."
Deepanshu Dewan commented publicly: "your ticket has been assigned to an agent. You will receive an update soon"

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: Support did not ask the customer to re-provide the same information or ignore previously provided details; instead they acknowledged impact and provided an outage explanation and next steps.
evidence: Customer: "We are unable to view or claim any new incoming chats... a manual refresh is required... taking over 10 minutes to appear"
Balaji Jayaraman commented publicly: "The disruption was triggered by background data processing placing unexpected load on our search infrastructure... no data loss occurred."

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: Public responses occurred quickly the same day as reporting, and there is no customer-facing complaint about prolonged waiting. CSV shows no L1/L2 open time accumulation.
evidence: Deepanshu Dewan commented publicly (same day): "Thank you for calling Khoros Care Support... You will receive an update soon"

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: Although the ticket ultimately closed (per CSV), the last customer question about preventing recurrence received a direct reply; there is no later customer message indicating an unresolved request at the time of closure.
evidence: Customer: "Kindly confirm whether the fix you have implemented will prevent this issue from recurring in the future."
Balaji Jayaraman commented publicly: "We’re strengthening monitoring and controls to catch similar performance issues earlier... to prevent recurrence."

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: The issue described production-impacting chat disruption, and support treated it as high priority (ticket assignment, escalation, and infra involvement) rather than generic end-user troubleshooting.
evidence: Customer: "We are unable to view or claim any new incoming chats in Khoros Care Production."
Pavly Nashed commented publicly: "this has been escalated to our infrastructure team with the highest priority"
